tourBios.exmtStatus: 38th Nationwide Tour Qualifier at the 2010 PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh: 2002: Rookie on the Nationwide Tour and made the cut in seven of 15 starts...His only top-25 finish was a T16 at the Knoxville Open...Made the cut in one of four prior starts. 2001: Won twice on the Hooters Tour. Made the cut in 21 of 22 events and finished No. 3 on the Hooters Tour money list. Ended the year with a scoring average of 69.03. 1996: Was T34 at the Mississippi Gulf Coast Open...Winner of several mini-tour events..Three-time winner of the Alabama Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was named South Alabama's Outstanding Player in 1990...Attended Central High School in Tuscaloosa, where he was part of a state championship team in 1986.
tourBios.otherInfo: Lists Ron Gring as his instructor...Says he hasn't had his biggest thrill in golf yet. Biggest thrill outside of golf was the birth of his son...Would like to play Augusta National some day...Never travels without his phone...Favortie college teams are Alabama and South Alabama and his pro team is the Atlanta Braves. "Family Guy" is his favorite TV show and movie is "The Shawshank Redemption." Favorite entertainer is Beck, food is M&M's and athlete to watch is Tiger Woods. Favorite city to visit is New York and vacation spot is Jamaica...Superstitions include never using yellow tees or golf balls with the No. 4...Would put President Barrack Obama, Rush Limbaugh and a photographer in his dream foursome...Not many people know that he will "never, ever sing in public" and his Bucket list includes getting out of debt...Father played football for Paul "Bear" Bryant at Alabama.
tourBios.priorYearSeason: Has not competed on the Nationwide Tour since 2002 and has never played on the PGA TOUR.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T16th in 2002 at the Knoxville Open.
